channel.title: Obfuscating File Type
channel.description: How would a person go about hiding the true file type of a file? For example, let's say I have a folder full of confidential information. I make an encrypted ZIP file, and change the file type to .null. However, if I run the `file` command, it still shows up as a ZIP file. Is there anyway to truly hide it?

item.title: Obfuscating File Type
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Obfuscating File Type
item.dc:creator: 314159365358Pi
item.description:
You could also try overwriting any file signatures(Magic bytes, sectors, etc.), save them and somehow recover them for the saved data.

Read full topic

item.title: Obfuscating File Type
item.dc:creator: ShellHunter123
item.description:
just make the file extension null
or you can also hide the file with attrib command in cmd

Read full topic
